description: {{nihongo||津軽三味線, つがるじゃみせん|'''Tsugaru-jamisen'''}} or {{nihongo||つがるしゃみせん|'''Tsugaru-shamisen'''}} refers to both the Japanese genre of {{transliteration|ja|[[shamisen]]}} music originating from [[Tsugaru Peninsula]] in present-day [[Aomori Prefecture]] and the instrument it is performed with. It is performed throughout Japan, though associations with the Tsugaru remain strong.  {{transliteration|ja|Tsugaru-jamisen}} is considered the most recognized genre of {{transliteration|ja|shamisen}} music, and has enjoyed multiple periods of popularity in Japan.
